Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Class which defines the tic-tac-toe board
    Author:
    Andru

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private char[][] board
      Actual board, represented as matrix of chars (the chars can be either X or O)
      private int emptyPlaces
      Stores number of empty places on the board.
      private int size
      Size of the board is implicitly 3

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Default constructor, simply initializes the board as a 3x3 board (using the first constructor)
      Board(int size)
      Constructor for making the board of a specific size

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      char getCharacter(int line, int column)
      Method for returning the character of a specific position on the board.
      int getSize()
      Simple getter for board size
      private boolean inBounds(Point p)
      Method which checks if a given point is within the bounds of the game
      boolean isFull()
      Method for checking if the board is full or not
      private boolean isOccupied(Point p)
      Method which checks if a given point on the board is occupied (there is already a character there)
      boolean putCharacter(Point p, char c)
      Method for putting a character on the board.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Method for returning a String representation of the board.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • size

        private int size
        Size of the board is implicitly 3

      • board

        private char[][] board
        Actual board, represented as matrix of chars (the chars can be either X or O)

      • emptyPlaces

        private int emptyPlaces
        Stores number of empty places on the board. Initially, the entire board is empty

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(int size)
        Constructor for making the board of a specific size

      • Board

        public Board()
        Default constructor, simply initializes the board as a 3x3 board (using the first constructor)

    • Method Detail

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Method for checking if the board is full or not
        Returns:
        returns true if board is full, false otherwise

      • inBounds

        private boolean inBounds(Point p)
        Method which checks if a given point is within the bounds of the game
        Parameters:
        p - point
        Returns:
        returns true if the point is within the bounds or false otherwise

      • isOccupied

        private boolean isOccupied(Point p)
        Method which checks if a given point on the board is occupied (there is already a character there)
        Parameters:
        p - point
        Returns:
        returns true if the point on the board is occupied

      • putCharacter

        public boolean putCharacter(Point p,
                   char c)
        Method for putting a character on the board.
        Parameters:
        p - point where we put a character on the board
        c - character which we are putting on the board
        Returns:
        returns true if move was successful

      • getCharacter

        public char getCharacter(int line,
                int column)
        Method for returning the character of a specific position on the board. Because of how this function is used, it's easier to specify line and column, rather than Point.
        Parameters:
        line - line coordinate
        column - column coordinate
        Returns:
        the character at point p on the board

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Simple getter for board size
        Returns:
        returns board size

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Method for returning a String representation of the board. Used for printing
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
